revised_title: Experiments on Hyperoxymuriates and the Production of a New Gas
tldr: Sir Humphry Davy investigates the action of acids on hyperoxymuriates and discovers a new gas with unique properties. The gas is aromatic, explosive, and reacts with phosphorus but not with other combustible materials. The author suggests that the gas may be a mixture of the new gas and chlorine, but declines to name it until further experiments are conducted.
